page.title: 01SW Hamilton- General View
page.content: This area is to the SW of the town of Hamilton in Strathclyde. It partially consists of housing estates, and partially of countryside. The housing estates are in the NE of the area. Most of the area surveyed is used for farming; mainly by raising cattle and sheep. The land slopes to the NE, steeply down into the Clyde Valley, north of Hamilton. There are few trees, mostly shelter belts or wooded river valleys. At one time the area had extensive mining operations, but these have all been closed, as has the Hamilton to Strathaven railway that ran through the area. Industry is confined to a small number of factories on an industrial estate. Estimated population about 12,000.
